title.native: 七つの大罪 戒めの復活
title.romaji: Nanatsu no Taizai: Imashime no Fukkatsu
title.english: The Seven Deadly Sins: Revival of the Commandments

description:
Melodias, Hawk, and Elizabeth retook the Kingdom of Leones from the Holy Knights. The festival went off without a hitch and the crew enjoyed their well-earned peace. And yet, another threat looms on the horizon. The Ten Commandments, a group of elite demon clan warriors, have their sights set on the kingdom.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: The Seven Deadly Sins: Die Rückkehr der Gebote
ศึกตำนาน 7 อัศวิน ภาค 2 คืนชีพบัญญัติสิบประการ
The Seven Deadly Sins: Odrodzenie przykazań

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

node.description:
[Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/suzukinakaba/)

Japanese manga artist who has published works in Weekly Shounen Jump, Weekly Shounen Sunday, and Weekly Shounen Magazine.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/furuoh)

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sasakino00) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木啓悟F)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). 
Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures). 
Currently affiliated with [CygamesPicture](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**
Takafumi Wada is a Japanese Composer.
Affiliated with KUSANAGI.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kohta_yamabook) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yamabook_kohta/) | [Website](https://www.kohtayamamoto.net/)

Formerly affiliated with Legendoor, he is now in business partnership with VV-ALKLINE.

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist
- [Kohshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032) (浅川甲史) | KOHSHI - Vocalist, Occasional rhythm guitarist
- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass

Website | Twitter | Facebook | Artist page (lantis) Introduction Granrodeo (stylized as GRANRODEO, and also known as KISHOW x e-Zuka) is a Japanese rock band, specializing in creating anime soundtracks. They are currently under the record label Lantis (2005-2009, 2012-), while previously having been under GloryHeaven (2009-2012) Biography In 2005 voice actor Kishō Taniyama ("Kishow") and musician Masaaki Iizuka ("E-Zuka"), known for his collaborations in creating anime soundtracks, decided to create a new project. During their years as a band, they released a few singles that were used as opening singles for the anime series. In 2007 they released their first album, Ride on the Edge, and in 2008 they release a second album, Instinct. In spring 2009 they started working on the soundtrack, the series Needless, for which E-Zuka wrote the soundtracks and Kishow wrote the lyrics for the song "Modern Strange Cowboy". By the end of 2009, they released their third album, Brush the Scar Lemon. In 2011 they released their fourth album, Supernova, and in 2012 they released their fifth album Crack Star Flash. Granrodeo covered "Tell Me" for the June 6, 2018 hide tribute album Tribute Impulse. Members Kishou Taniyama (谷山紀章/Kishow) - vocals, lyrics. (2005-) According to him, the role of a vocalist is more suitable for him than the role of a voice actor. Masaaki Iizuka (飯塚昌明/E-Zuka) - Guitar, composer, arranging. (2005-) His style of playing the guitar combines melodic solo parts and aggressive guitar riffs. He also collaborates with Minami Kuribayashi. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayuge1017)

A Tokyo Zoukei University graduate, he's one of the leading digital animators in the industry, with good character animation and catchy effects.

He is a "follower" of [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/). In his university days, he was in the same circle as [Ryuu Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/133512/). They still have a good relationship and work with each other a lot. 

He is also a good friend of [Takahito Sakazume](https://anilist.co/staff/131945/), the two working often as a "two man production team."

Enokido is mainly known for his work on the Fate franchise, being both the action director for [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/) and having directed the majority of the [Fate/Grand Order Commercials](https://anilist.co/anime/101184/).
[Website](http://www.anly-singer.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Anly_Singer)

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.

__[Website](https://sky-peace.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/skypeace_teojin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8_wmm5DX9mb4jrLiw8ZYzw)__

__Formed:__ 2016

__Introduction:__
Sky Peace is a Japanese music unit under record label Sony Music Entertainment, affiliated with Epic Records Japan. The duo consists of Vine star Ooki Terashima and Nico Nico Douga rapper Jin Fujieda, who through a mutual relationship on Twitter decided to form a musical group.

__Members:__
- Theo-kun (テオくん), also known by real name Ooki Terashima (寺島大輝) – vocalist
- Ini (☆イニ☆), also known by real name Jin Fujieda (藤枝仁), otherwise simply known as Jin (じん) – vocalist
[Blog](http://moon.ap.teacup.com/micat/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/miccabose) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/miccabose) | [Myspace](http://www.myspace.com/mikakobayashi)

__Mpi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and translator known to frequently collaborate with [Hiroyuki Sawano](https://anilist.co/staff/103509/Hiroyuki-Sawano) in his vocal project SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]. He has lived 5 years in New York, USA, and his name is an abbreviation for Music Pro Inc.

[Twitter](https://x.com/mpimusic_info)

__Mpi__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and translator known to frequently collaborate with [Hiroyuki Sawano](https://anilist.co/staff/103509/Hiroyuki-Sawano) in his vocal project SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]. He has lived 5 years in New York, USA, and his name is an abbreviation for Music Pro Inc.

[Twitter](https://x.com/mpimusic_info)

__Members:__
- Theo-kun (テオくん), also known by real name Ooki Terashima (寺島大輝) – vocalist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chororoles) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chororoles/)

A Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Mordecai in _Regular Show_ and James Gordon in _Gotham_.

He's the father of [Abril Gómez](https://anilist.co/staff/203264/Abril-Gmez).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2894227226) | [Tumblr](https://henrythurlow.tumblr.com/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/HTAnimations) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/HenryThurlowAnimator)

Formerly affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) between 2021 and 2024.

Graduated Pratt Institute with a Bachelor in Fine Arts in Animation in 2006.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1782989852717539328) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=shota_goshozono)

Originating from [Xebec Zwei](https://anilist.co/studio/898/Xebec-Zwei). Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).
